name: @bentley/imodeljs-backend

scripts.pretest: npm run copy:test-assets && rush build -t @bentley/imodeljs-backend && cpx ./src/test/logging.config.json ./lib/test

//peerDependencies: NOTE: The @bentley/imodeljs-native-platform-api dependency is REPEATED here, so that clients such as protogist
will see a warning from NPM INSTALL in case they depend on an incompatible version of the addon and/or API version.
//devDependencies: NOTE: All peerDependencies should also be listed as devDependencies since peerDependencies are not considered by npm install
NOTE: All tools used by scripts in this package must be listed as devDependencies
//dependencies: NOTE: these dependencies are specific to imodeljs-backend
NOTE: these dependencies should be only for things that DO NOT APPEAR IN THE API
NOTE: backend directly depends on the node and electron addons as a help to apps. Most apps by far will use one
or the other of these addons. And, most apps will be installed by npm. So, by putting these dependencies here, we can
relieve most apps of the burden of even thinking about 'the addon'. In fact, the addon is not really separate from
imodeljs-backend but is just part of its internal implementation. We want apps to think about backend, not the addon.
NOTE: While, imodeljs-native-platform-api seems like it should be a devDependency, it is actually required at run time.
The NativePlatformRegistry reads it in order to learn what API was used to compile backend. (Also, if we don't make it a real dependency here, then
apps would have to depend on it, as imodeljs-native-platform-node has a peerDependency on it.
NOTE: These dependencies do not suffice to supply the imodeljs-backend or testbed unit tests with the addons that they need.
*** Keep this in synch with nativePlatformForTests ***
//optionalDependencies: NOTE: Rush (as of 4.2.5) does not support optionalDependencies!
